author: wsjcom
title: Seattle Is Abusing Its Mobile Golden Geese
text:
Regarding the “Seattle to Business: Drop Dead” (Review & Outlook, May 16) message that Seattle’s City Council gave to business: The problem being addressed was that the high cost of housing in the city was increasing the number of homeless people in the community.
Four years after the start of the great aerospace recession, the financial crisis of the Boeing company and the resulting mass exodus from the city, I was able to buy a basic, 900-square-foot house for around $30,000. Other young professionals were able to live...
